*[Bug 17289] Inconsistent NA handling in scan()*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=17289>

--- Comment #2 from Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) ---
Created attachment 3340
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3340&action=edit>
Disallow string NA to become missing if absent from na.strings

Here's a patch that resolves the reported issue, though I'm not as confident it
doesn't cause other issues. Testing in
<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/pull/164>.

*[Bug 16881] readChar() on url() returns inconsistent number of characters*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16881>

Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |michaelchirico4@gmail.com

--- Comment #3 from Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) ---
I'm not reproducing OP's issue. `nchars=1e5` is no longer sufficient, I
switched to `nchars=1e7` with the following output of OP's code:

```
for (i in 1:10) {
        u <- url(ftp, open = "rb")
        r <- readChar(u, nchars = 1e7, useBytes = TRUE)
        print(nchar(r))
        close(u)
}

# read the text file from url() using useBytes = FALSE
u <- url(ftp, open = "rb")
r <- readChar(u, nchars = 1e7, useBytes = FALSE)
nchar(r)
close(u)

# read the text file locally using useBytes = TRUE
tf <- tempfile()
download.file(ftp, tf, quiet=TRUE)
r <- readChar(tf, nchars = 1e7, useBytes = TRUE)
unlink(tf)
nchar(r)
[1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
# [1] 4769548
```

Obviously a long time has passed and the asset in question could easily have
changed many times in the interim. Or this could be a platform-specific issue
(I'm on Ubuntu). Otherwise the R code has been fixed in the meantime.

All told, I would move to closing this as not reproducible, and encourage a new
issue be opened if the issue still persists with some other asset.

text:
*[Bug 16750] Treat character as factor in summary.default*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16750>

--- Comment #3 from Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) ---
Thanks Elin. Perhaps we can get to `summary.character()` with a nice set of
options to cover the most common ways to summarize a character vector --
re-using `summary.factor()` is just a way to get closer without going through
too much design discussion.

Regardless, I think any single choice would be better than the current
behavior, which is clearly uninformative.
